description.narrative: IR 2.4 WASH in SchoolsSustainable latrines, water, and hand washing facilities in at least 200 schools in 28 districts and improved hygiene and education in 3,600 schools for 1,080,000 children in 75 target districts obtained through development of innovative solutions to existing bottlenecks in schools.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Other activities for equitable access to quality education e.g. school feeding, school grants
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Uganda 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Uganda Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.4 WASH in SchoolsSustainable latrines, water, and hand washing facilities in at least 200 schools in 28 districts; and improved hygiene and education in 3,600 schools for 1,080,000 children in 75 target districts obtained through development of innovative solutions to existing bottlenecks in schools.
% of target districts whose primary schools apply effective micro-organisms (EMO) to latrines
Number and % of schools in target districts where children are accessing safe drinking water
Number and % of schools in target districts benefitting from hygiene promotion and education
Number and % of schools in target districts whose children are accessing bio litrines

actual.value: 2015:Bio- latrines in 3 schools in Amuru, Nwoya & Tororo benefitting over 6,500 children.

title.narrative: % of schools in 28 districts with access to functional hand washing facilities

actual.value: 2015:No national level data and approach to hand washing was changed to campaigns for both schools and communities.

title.narrative: Pupil:Stance ratio in schools in the 28 target districts
